casebody.data:
Lance Hanson AYERS, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. 482018-DIV: “N”; Allen Correctional; 19th Judicial, Defendants-Appellees. No. 05-30858

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Oct. 24, 2006. Lance Hanson Ayers, Kinder, LA, pro se. Before JOLLY, DeMOSS, and STEWART, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM: *

Lance Hanson Ayers, Louisiana prisoner # 122241, appeals the district court’s dismissal of his complaint for failure to comply with a court order to amend his pleadings. We previously remanded this matter to the district court to allow the court to rule on a post-judgment motion by Ayers seeking reinstatement of his suit. The district court subsequently granted the motion and ordered the case reinstated on the district court’s docket. Accordingly, because the judgment which is the subject of this appeal has been vacated, the present appeal does not present a live case or controversy and is dismissed as moot. See Rocky v. King, 900 F.2d 864, 867 (5th Cir.1990).

APPEAL DISMISSED.

Pursuant to 5th Cir R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under *819the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
